Sylph::IllegalArgumentException

Sylph::IllegalArgumentException Class Reference

Generic exception to flag an argument with an illegal state was passed to an function or method. More...

#include <Sylph/Core/Exception.h>

Inherits Sylph::Exception.

virtual const char * name () const throw ()
 Returns the class name of this Exception.

Detailed Description

Generic exception to flag an argument with an illegal state was passed to an function or method.

Member Function Documentation

virtual const char* Sylph::IllegalArgumentException::name (  )  const throw () [inline, virtual]

Returns the class name of this Exception.

If you used the S_CREATE_EXCEPTION(name) macro, this will be automatically filled in for you. Otherwise you'll have to put in the name yourself. This is purely diagnostic information.

Returns:
The name of the class of this Exception.

Reimplemented from Sylph::Exception.
